page.title: 01LOCAL HISTORY
page.content: { Our area is situated at the S.W. edge of the Greater Manchester connurbation, on the edge of the Pennine Hills. There has been a sizeable community here since the early 18th.century when the swiftly flowing streams were harnessed to provide water power for a large number of small cotton mills. As the mills became larger, the population of the area grew to keep pace. When later {Samuel Oldknow}began to mine coal in the area, then began transporting limestone via the canal from Derbyshire to burn in lime kilns in Marple and finally owned the largest mill, the prosperity of the area seemed assured. Unfortunately the cotton business began to decline, but by this time the roads and railways had enabled Marple and district to become commuter land.
